alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Hale; Lubbock; Lynn (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 7:59AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following counties, Crosby, Floyd, Hale, Hockley, Lubbock, Lynn and Terry. * WHEN...Until 930 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 759 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated intense rainfall rates up to one half inch in 5 minutes due to strong to severe thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.1 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Much of the city of Lubbock is in a Flash Flood Warning because of the increased runoff in urban areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lubbock, Levelland, Brownfield, Slaton, Floydada, Abernathy, Tahoka, Crosbyton, White River Lake, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Idalou, Ralls, Sundown, Petersburg, Lorenzo, Ransom Canyon, O`Donnell, Kalgary and Woodrow. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
